alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 12:26PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack promoting continued high river flows. For the Marys River...including Test - Charleston, Deeth, Charleston...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Marys River Near Deeth. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, This is monitoring stage or about 365 cfs. No flooding occurs within the reach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.4 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 5.7 feet early Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
